channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Experts say the high failure rate in AI adoption isn’t a bug, but a feature: ‘Has anybody ever started to ride a bike on the first try?’
item.description: At Fortune's Most Powerful Women event, one thing was clear: We're still on the "jagged frontier" of AI adoption.

item.title: To lead in AI, start smaller
item.description: If you want people to adopt AI, you must change the systems that guide them.

item.title: Marketing leaders say AI is rewriting how brands reach Gen Z and millennials: ‘Forget what you know; learn this’
item.description: Top executives say AI is helping their users lean into being more personable.

item.title: The Louvre Heist
item.description: Today, we look at how thieves pulled off this weekend’s brazen daylight robbery in Paris and why they did it.

item.title: Nations Hesitate to Send Troops to Gaza, Fearing Clashes With Hamas
item.description: The Trump peace plan calls for an international security force in the Gaza Strip, but countries that might send troops are wary of danger, an unclear ...

item.title: Judges Warn of ‘Judicial Crisis,’ and Universities Reject Trump Offer
item.description: Plus, a drastic drop in peanut allergies.

item.title: This is the worst the jobs market has looked (outside of a recession) in 50 years, says Goldman Sachs, meaning bullish GDP estimates are too optimistic
item.description: Jan Hatzius warns America’s job market slump could drag down growth, with frontloaded orders and AI disruption skewing GDP signals.

item.title: Grace Wales Bonner Is Named Creative Director of Men’s Wear at Hermès
item.description: Grace Wales Bonner is the new creative director of men’s wear at the French fashion house.

item.title: France Sends Former President Nicolas Sarkozy to Prison to Start 5-Year Sentence
item.description: Nicolas Sarkozy, the president of France from 2007 to 2012, received a five-year sentence after being convicted in a campaign finance scandal.

item.title: $50 billion fintech CEO says stop selling AI. Customers don’t care and ‘just want their problem solved’
item.description: The CEO of the largest digital bank says stop peddling new technology as your selling point.

item.title: France Sends Former President Nicolas Sarkozy to Prison to Start 5-Year Sentence
item.description: Nicolas Sarkozy, the president of France from 2007 to 2012, received a five-year sentence after being convicted in a campaign finance scandal.
